alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 4:12PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of central Washington County through 500 PM EST... At 411 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Vanceboro to 15 miles south of Grand Lake Stream. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Calais, Vanceboro, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Topsfield, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper, Crawford and Waite. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Princeton and Waite. State Highway 9 between Wesley and Baring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington
